channel.title: Ue5 on voithos.io
channel.description: Recent content in Ue5 on voithos.io

item.title: Unreal Debugging
item.description: As a large and mature engine, Unreal provides a suite of debugging systems and tools to aid development, which go hand-in-hand with your standard C++ debugger. This page aims to give an incomplete and mostly unordered whirlwind tour of some of the more useful tools I’ve run across while working in Unreal. If I’ve missed anything big or particularly useful, I’d love to hear about it! Note that most of my experience thus far has been in UE versions 4.

item.title: Fast Chaos Collision Toggling
item.description: A few weeks ago I investigated an interesting physics-related performance issue, specific to UE5’s new Chaos physics engine. The code I was working on managed a large number of UStaticMeshComponents (essentially, it’s a custom hierarchical level-of-detail system) and would frequently need to toggle visibility and collision shapes per tick. There were some cases where we seemed to be going over our frame budget, so I took a profile via Unreal Insights:
